summary: Implemented a new hover-region tracking hook and updated SiteHeader to use a single controlled openDropdownId with hover-to-open behavior (at least for the shown “solutions” dropdown), including logic to keep the dropdown open while the pointer is over the trigger or the portal-rendered panel. However, due to truncation, it’s not fully verifiable that *all* top-level items with children were updated to the same behavior. Also, some repository metadata/summary files were changed in ways not requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Apply hover-open + keep-open-until-pointer-leaves-trigger-and-panel behavior to each top-level desktop header menu item that has children (not just a single special-cased item).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff excerpt shows the new hover behavior and hover-region hook wired for a special-cased "Our Solutions" item (item.id === 'solutions'), but the remainder of SiteHeader.tsx is truncated, so there is no clear evidence that every other top-level item with children uses the same controlled open state + hover-region handling.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated repository metadata to track new feature requests (AR-1/AR-2/AR-3) in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for frontend interaction changes; it does not request adding/updating project tracking metadata.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated frontend-file-summaries.txt to claim a wide set of unrelated frontend changes (navigation reorder, new content types/pages/routes, styling tokens, etc.).
hallucinated_features.reason: These changes are outside the BuildRequest scope/non-goals (no IA/content changes, no new navigation items). While this file is only a summary document, its newly added claims are not requested and could be misleading.
